runs.comm: good start, short of a length, beats Rutherford's attempt to upper cut it down to third man
back of a length on leg stump, at the body, worked off the hip backward of square on the leg side
legs pumping, he likes the look of the bounce on offer, this is outside off and defended square
angled into the pads this time, comfortably worked backward of square on the leg side
goes full for the first time, Rutherford is a little on the back foot and squirts it towards backward point...a well-judged single by Guptill from the non-striker's end
on off stump, tight delivery, pushed to backward point
on the stumps, quite full, pushed into the covers
first chance for him to free his arms and he does so in style, was only fractionally outside off and nowhere near a half volley...he drove on the up between backward point and cover
another drive into the off side, this was a fuller delivery, and he picks out cover
driven straight on this occasional, but doesn't quite time this one and mid-off has the chance to cut it off with a slide and dive
good line, on middle and off, defended into the covers
neatly dropped into the off side, used soft hands so the ball didn't run very far off the bat and cover couldn't get in quick enough
expansive drive outside off, 142kph from Finn, and he is beaten by good bounce from short of a length
very nicely bowled, beats the edge again, this time with a fuller delivery which moves away late off the seam
back of a length outside off, Guptill stands tall and drives off the back foot fine of point and wide of third man

plenty happened on this ball! Guptill gets an inside edge into his boot as he drives, Finn falls over in his follow through, then Rutherford would have been run out if Morgan had hit from backward point
full outside leg stump, shapes to flick it away and misses out...gets taken on the pads
excellent shot, short of a length outside off and Rutherford back-cuts it very fine wide of slip and fine of third man
tries something more expansive, attempts to heave a full delivery through the leg side but only gets it as far as mid-on
steps across the crease and tucks this from off stump through square leg
first one gone, short ball works. Banged in on leg stump, 143kph which is lively and a good line, Rutherford gets into tangle as he tries to pull and the ball loops off his glove to short fine-leg
length delivery on middle, defended back to the bowler
pushed onto the pads and flicked out to deep square-leg
low full toss which he doesn't put away, caught a little by surprise, as he drives it to mid-off
well bowled, locates a good yorker which can only be dug out towards cover
short of a length, nips in a touch to Guptill, runs towards short fine-leg
back of a length outside off, defended to the covers

big appeal for two things, firstly an lbw as the ball nipped back and looked to high and I think England had a go for the catch by Buttler in case there was an inside edge. There wasn't. Testing delivery, though.
this one is full outside off, McCullum forces himself forward but can't beat backward point
the bounces makes it awkward again, McCullum keen to get onto the front foot and he takes his bottom hand off the bat as this flies off the edge down to third
and he's welcomed by a scorching cover drive, leaned powerfully into the full delivery and places it between cover and mid-off. Classy.
drags the length back, McCullum responds by dropping it towards mid-off who is now hanging back towards the edge of the circle
flayed through the off side again, this time by Guptill, but it's not quite so cleanly struck which gives Broad the chase to get round from mid-off
lovely piece of timing, driving square and beats backward point but it doesn't quite have enough to reach the boundary as third man, Joe Root, makes excellent ground around the boundary
nips into McCullum, the ball drops down by his feet and Dernbach brings out his footballing skills from his follow through but Guptill is very safe
slower ball, Dernbach's first, Guptill waits for it and turns into the leg side
starts with a short ball which his pulled through midwicket but not quite out of the middle
short again and this one is dispatched, a skimmer from McCullum as he pulls with those incredible fast hands to beat deep square even though he only had a few metres to move
gets this fuller and it's worked into the midwicket area, Wright chases after it himself
placed into midwicket again, Guptill sets off thinking of a second but McCullum declines
another short ball, dangerous tactic to McCullum, and he gets away with it this time as the pull shot is nailed straight to deep square
a slightly more ugly heave to a full delivery, Guptill drags it wide of mid-on and deep midwicket cuts it off
short outside off and cut through backward point
offers up another one to cut square off the back foot to the cover sweeper
touch to short and wide to start, this time he gets cut in front of square so the sweeper runs the other direction
beautifully driven through the off side, opened his stance a fraction and placed it through the covers
comes round the wicket, Guptill comes down the pitch and chips this back over the bowler's head and it travels a fair distance
worked down to long-on, another good for New Zealand who are how starting to build as they reach 50
still bowling a little too short, Guptill doesn't get this out of the middle as he pulls through midwicket
very sweetly driven as Wright goes fuller, goes straight to mid-off and it was so well-struck it was a dot ball
poor delivery, short outside stump, McCullum swivels and pulls backward of square
that's better, gets a full ball in on middle and leg but some excellent running makes it two after the ball is squeezed into the big gap on the leg side at midwicket
a crunching straight drive, which nearly takes off one of Wright's fingers as he sticks out a hand in his follow through. Takes a little pace off the ball and they get back for another two
friendly full toss outside off, only costs him a single, though, as it's driven to long-off
stays round the wicket, worked off the back foot through midwicket
comes down the pitch and drives neatly to long-off

well caught! Key wicket. McCullum tries to go over midwicket with the slog sweep but it comes off a bit of a top edge, miles into the air, and Bairstow steadies himself expertly at deep midwicket. Would have been six in the previous two matches
but it's Guptill on strike and he pushes this to midwicket
can't beat the off side field this time as Tredwell bowls quicker and flatter
gets this one wide of the bowler down to long-on
also around the wicket, tucked off the back foot to deep square
quite flat from Root, on off stump, driven down the off side and he gets across
can't beat short third man as he opens the face
that's more like the Ross Taylor the world stage knows, goes for the slog sweep and comfortably clears deep midwicket

gone! Tries to repeat the short and picks out deep midwicket where Bairstow is lurking again. Superb bowling from Root, he held this one back, it was about 15ks slower, and he did Taylor in the flight. Impressive nerve
neatly played, this is a touch short outside off and it's deflected fine of short third man but Broad chases it down well
worked into the leg side
full and flicked to midwicket
outside off but Elliott goes for the sweep and gets it to deep square-leg
shorter, whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
outside leg stump, a well-timed flicked but it goes straight to deep midwicket
midwicket is a popular area, for scoring and wickets, this one clears the boundary into the stands from another slog sweep
flat on leg stump, goes for the sweep and comes off a bottom edge to short fine-leg
neat play, steps outside leg stump to open up the off side and gets it over backward point
nearly gets a leading edge as he tries to turn this through the leg side and it goes to cover
worked wide of midwicket
dragged a fraction short, but only costs him a single as Elliott paddles it around to deep square
full at off stump, squirted into the off side and Broad fields at short third man
short on leg stump but the batsmen are finding fielders at the moment as this is pulled to deep  square
steps outside leg stump and drives down to long-off without much timing
gets forward and drives, very correctly, down the ground
can't beat the off side as he drives a full delivery to cover
that's nicely played as he lofts this inside out over cover and wide of long-off but Root is quick on the boundary
a short ball and he inside edges the pull into his pads then it bobbles into the off side
beats a rather half-hearted cut from Elliott, was a fairly gentle loosener outside off stump

good catch at third man, England have caught well this series. Short outside off stump, Dernbach tries to ramp it fine of third man but Finn makes good ground to his left. He didn't really go through with the shot.
tries to slash through the off side, it's a slower ball, and comes off a thick edge to third man
full on off stump, he opens the face and runs it down to third man
a slower short ball, 111kph, Guptill has to wait and wait then pulls to deep square
full on middle and off, Munro punches it back to Dernbach in his follow through. Tight, and successful, comeback over
worked off the pads to deep square

short ball works again, ordinary from Munro. Well-directed on middle and leg, Munro plays an ugly attempt to pull over the leg side and a top edge loops gently to Root trotting to his left from backward point
full outside off, pushed back to Broad...pressure growing on Guptill
shorter ball, fetches it from outside off and pulls to deep square
rare fumble in the deep at point which allows them to come back for a second
full outside off, Franklin only connects with fresh air as he aims a cover drive
short of a length on off stump, dropped towards backward point, just another single
excellent bouncer, well-directed and at pace. Franklin had thoughts of trying to play it down to third man but had to bail out of any shot
strong shot, fuller outside off stump, Franklin steps to leg then drives on the up just over the cover fielder to bring the first boundary for 27 balls
beaten outside off as he aims square
short on leg stump, this time he gets inside the line and it comes off the third pad to fine leg
gets lucky (or not depending on your point of view) as he aims a swipe across the line and the top edge falls between Buttler running back and third man coming in
greeted by another first-ball boundary, floated up outside off and it's slammed through the off side to beat long-off
full again, this time he goes leg side through midwicket and wide of long-on

excellent slower ball, Guptill can only drop it by his feet by they get through for the single that takes him to fifty...Dernbach kicked the ball into the stumps again from his follow through. Good skills.
beats the batsman outside leg stump, goes through Franklin's legs to the keeper but they steal a bye as Buttler's throw is wide
this one comes out of the middle, low full toss outside off and Guptill cracks it over deep midwicket. That will feel a bit better
gets back on a length at the stumps, Guptill steps to leg and swings hard getting a thick edge to third man
full on off stump, Guptill shuffles across and scoops (not in the Buttler sense) down to long-on
dropped, a rare mistake in the catching from England. Franklin gave himself a touch of room and drilled it hard to mid-off, but Finn could not quite get down to a very low chance. Tough.
short ball, beats him for pace at 143kph, can only splice his pull into the leg side
another bye is taken after Franklin was beaten by a short ball...Buttler not winning any games of ten-pin bowling right now. Franklin wanted a wide, too

short again, a wicket again. Guptill gets into a tangle as he tries to work this to leg and gets a top edge that Broad takes easily. Not a free-flowing innings, he never hit top gear. The value, or otherwise, will become clear a little later
another short ball, another fresh-air shot, another bye, another miss from Buttler behind the stumps
a slower short ball, back of the hand, beats Franklin and Buttler hurls wide of the timber again
Buttler doesn't need to throw this one because there's an edge on it. McCullum moving to leg to try and get it through the off side but can only guide it into the gloves
heaved into the leg side from a good length, rather dribbles to deep midwicket
top shot, short of a length and Franklin goes straight over mid-off who is inside the circle
back-to-back boundaries, this one with a little more luck as he swings to leg and gets a edge just wide of a flying Buttler...wasn't a chance
neat catch off the final ball, trying to go over the off side and can't get it further than cover moving back from the edge of the ring
